Transcribed 30.6.93. To proof.
Letter not found; it was read at an Executive Committee meeting held on 29 May 1868 and is dated accordingly.
[Mr Carson brought under the Committee notice a Letter which he had that morning received, from Dr Mueller, in which that gentleman directed attention to the fact of the cows of the Home being still allowed to graze on the Swamp and now that he had planted the piece of waste land facing the St Kilda Rd he urged that the arrangement made some weeks ago might at once be carried into effect.]
The Superintendent reported that the yard in which the cows were to be kept in future was just finished and on the following morning would be used. So that this day would be the final one of them grazing on the Swamp
The Committee directed that Dr Mueller be informed of the above and also that he be again assured of the Committee desire to render any assistance in their power towards the Improvement of the Reserve. M responded to the letter in M to J. Greig, June 1868 (in this edition as 68-06-00).
